name: The Pickled Onion B&B / Restaurant

reviews.text: We'd seen the positive reviews, but it was even better than we were expecting. Valerie was very welcoming and the cabana (Nohoch Nah) was even nicer than the pics show, with tiled floors, nicely furnished, fridge and tea and coffee-making facilities. It was a lot bigger inside than it looked from the outside. The garden setting was a delight, lots of birds about. We were unlucky with the weather so a bit cold for the pool, but it looked great for a dip in the more usual weather. Food was great, choice a bit restricted, but this meant service was the fastest and most efficient we've ever experienced in Mexico; the restaurant is very nicely laid out and comfortable. Its very handy for visiting Uxmal but there's plenty more to visit close by, including Kabah, only about 3 miles away. There's lots of wild areas close by. Apart from the occasional lorry rumbling by, the setting is very peaceful aand relaxed. Overall, one of the nicest places we've stopped in for a long time.
reviews.title: Lovely cabanas, lovely food, great service

reviews.text: This B&B with little houses to stay in should not be missed! Theowner has gone to great lengths to make this a pleasant place to stay, the prices are reasonable and the food is great. We are budget conscious travelers and tend to eat at local restaurants and the food at the Pickled Onion was as good or better than any we had on this trip! There is no AC so I can not speak to how hot the houses are in the summer, but in January, with a ceiling fan, we did not have any issues. The bathroom was partially open to the room, understandable because of the tall peaked roofs. Nice pool for swimming. Wifi only in the restaurant, shuts off around 9:00, but to have wifi at all in that location is very nice. Very well located for trips to Uxmal and the other ruins, Valerie is most helpful with answers to your questions and will find tours guides if you want her to. And the packed lunches are a good deal, nicely prepared. We stayed two nights. There were no mosquitoes at this time, no netting needed.
reviews.title: Great experience

reviews.text: If you are going to make the ruta Puuc, this is the place to stay! A b&b made with love!
reviews.title: Magical place to stay!

reviews.text: It has the feeling of home but in the middle of nowhere in Mexico! Very close to Uxmal so the place is really inspiring!
reviews.title: Friendliness would be first of all required

reviews.text: Very comfy and sweet! Good value for what you pay! Once you stay for 1 night you won't want to leave!
reviews.title: cold beer and really good food

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I spent 3 nights at the Pickled Onion while visiting the Ruta Puuc area. This turned out to be one of my all-time favorite places that I have stayed - rustic luxury at its best. I absolutely loved it. Valerie has created a wonderful place on the edge of Santa Elena. The whole place has a terrific atmosphere - casual, relaxed, balanced. It is as though any stress or worry that you bring from the outside world is instantly disolved upon arrival. The staff are great - friendly and gracious - very helpful. And the location is perfect for visiting the area.
reviews.title: Simply marvelous

reviews.text: The restaurant is open-air and faces the road. It is set up on a small hill, so it is a bit removed from the traffic of the road (not a busy road by any means) and a nice place to watch the comings and goings in the area - it also catches a nice breeze in the evenings. Each night there were dinner guests from other lodging in the area as well as guests of the Pickled Onion - it was nice to talk with people and hear about their sightseeing. The food is wonderful with plenty of Yucatecan specialties and the prices were very reasonable.
reviews.title: Great except for the roosters

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bungalows are set in a garden behind the restaurant, arranged around the pool as the central feature. They are placed so that no bungalow looks directly at another, which is nice - and with the trees and bushes in the garden, everything feels spacious and private even though the property is not large.
reviews.title: Great place
Exceeded our expectations ! ... a "diamond" in the Yucatan...
reviews.text: Our bungalow was very nice - they are all oval-shaped with thatched roofs in the traditional mayan style. We had plenty of room with a very comfortable bed and a seating area, plenty of space to put our suitcases. The bed was very comfortable and the linens were nice. We had a small fridge, which was a nice suprise - we didn't expect to have that type of amenity. Our bungalow was decorated very well and we even had a coffee table book about the mayan sites. The thatched roof allows for small lizards to come in, which I loved - we were visited by a couple little guys during our stay. They stayed up in the thatch and we could hear them rumaging around up there - they are small and do not bother anything. The thatch is tight enough that nothing larger can get in.

There is no A/C here, but we found that by leaving the windows open and using the fan, we had a nice comfortable temperature in our bungalow. The windows are such that you can leave them open all night without worry - fully screened so no mosquitos can come in and set high enough in the all that no one from outside can see much.
reviews.title: Perfect...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent only one night in the Pickled Onion in our trip from Calakmul to the Puuc Route.
reviews.title: A little paradise near to the Puuc Route

reviews.text: We arrived very late in the night (22.30) but the owner Valerie was still waiting for us and, when we told her we hadn't eaten yet, she immediately prepared an excellent sandwich for us. The breakfast also was delicious as well as the lunch box we bought for the next day (sandwich, salad, fresh fruit and a small pack of dry fruits). The "cabanas" here are very nice, accurate in every detail and you will also find some books waiting for you and helping to discover this region. Our only regret? To have spent just one night here !
reviews.title: Best Hotel of our mexico trip

reviews.text: The hotel is in the middle of the jungle, the huts are well furnished and very clean. The owner Valerie is very frindly and helpful. The location is perfect to see all the ruines in this area. I wouled stay there for more days then only one.
reviews.title: Great place and nice atmosphere to stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Pickled Onion ist a very beautifull and lovely place to stay. Valerie and her Team are so friendly and helpful.The Mayan hut we stayed were very clean and so nice decorated.Thanks again for the upgrade. The Dinner and Cocktails as well as the breakfast was very delicious. We enyojed the time so much.Thanks again for meeting you and your Team.
reviews.title: wish I could have stayed much longer!

reviews.text: Valerie & her staff are warm & welcoming & make every effort to ensure guests are comfortable & well-informed. The Mayan houses are wonderful - traditionally built but with hot shower & fridge + coffee/ tea-making facilities for a perfect stay. The included breakfast is delicious - fresh & local/homemade as are other meals in the restaurant. Tip to British visitors: Valerie will love you forever if you take her some real English teabags! ;) We would dearly love to go back there...
reviews.title: Excellent Inn near Uxmal ruins

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After reading so many reviews about this B&B, we made it a point of staying here overnight. They didn't disappoint. There are several small Mayan-styled huts scattered throughout a beautifully maintained garden. Our hut was closest to the small pool, which had several chairs, tables and a hammock swinging over the shallow end. While the room was very basic and simple, it had everything we needed--INCLUDING a coffee maker with all the fixings (bless you, Valerie!)
reviews.title: Delightful!

reviews.text: I can't say enough about the graciousness of Valerie Pickles, the owner. She met each guest personally and made it a point to stop by and chat a bit with each one. We thoroughly enjoyed trading our experiences of living in Mexico with her. She went above and beyond by decorating the dining room with Valentine's Day hearts, and even had roses for all the women! Nice touch!
reviews.title: An ADORABLE PLACE!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Typical of hotels in this area, the windows are made of screen, not glass. The room had shutters that we closed at night for privacy, but that meant sacrificing any fresh breeze. Also, the toilet/shower were just on the other side of a partial wall--no doors, limited privacy. Just a couple things to know before you go.
reviews.title: A very rustic but nice environment :)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We started on the Puuc Route early in the morning, finishing up at the Loltun caves late in the afternoon, and stayed at Uxmal that night, wanting to be within walking distance of those ruins. The Pickled Onion was the perfect starting point for the loop, and Valerie couldn't have been a kinder hostess!
reviews.title: Really wonderful place to stay

aka: The Pickled Onion B&B / Restaurant Santa Elena, Mexico - Yucatan
description: Boutique Bed and Breakfast located close to Uxmal, Kabah, Sayil and Labnah. Quaint Maya style rooms, complete with private entrance, bathrooms, refrigerator ,coffe maker bottled water,toiletries,clean, comfortable and secure, set in peaceful surroundings. Rooms are adorned with my own paintings. Beautiful gardens with labyrinth. Area for Yoga, Tai chi etc. Mini Spa.swimming pool Excellent restaurant where you can taste some of the Yucatan cuisine. Located close to the village where you can experience Maya life as it really is.The newly built bar is open with great cocktails as well as wine and beer.Here you can connect to fast WI FI service for your conveinience All the staff are local people from Santa Elena and all structures were build by local people too, including wood work, iron work etc I maybe a foreign owner but how good that work has been created for the local people who would otherwise not have an income.
